intro: Centaurea nathadzeae, commonly known as the Nathadze's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Georgia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Centaurea nathadzeae is considered a rare and endangered species.
